p: Nanoemulsion: In nanoemulsion, tiny EO droplets are confined to a cavity surrounded by a unique polymer membrane [ 110]. The EO dispersion in water is obtained through the chemical action of surfactants. It is highly recommended to encapsulate EO into nanoemulsion-based delivery systems for different reasons: non-toxic and non-irritant, high kinetic stability, capacity to solubilize hydrophobic bioactive molecules and to enhance their bioavailability, and suitability for human and veterinary uses [ 111]. The nanoencapsulation of EOs can be performed using multiple techniques, such as high-pressure homogenization [ 104], micro-fluidization [ 112], and sonication [ 113].
